TopicTitle: Black Sun Laboratories Products *NOW FEATURING: PROJECT KEBYLON*

Articles.Content: Just keeping you up to date, guys: Blaze\'s release is delayed further. It\'s a nightmare texturing the current model, and I find it quite unsatisfactory (and non-Kerbal), plus I have learnt a few new things regarding modeling so I\'m redoing it from scratch. The good news is that it\'s going to have twice as much connection points now, most likely. Which means more insanity. Especially since I\'ll be making a batch of models for different ideas I had, which means more addons out at once.
More connection points? More chaos!

from what i saw yesterday on the livestream it looked as Blaze was a structural 'coupler' type module.... i wonder,would it be possible to make a 'winglet' type equivalent without too much work?

i dont know how module types work,but POSSIBLY just changing the actual engine holder part to a winglet might get the job done and even make it somewhat ASAS compatible,allthough i shudder to think what would it do with high-thrust engines attached

...I love you. I was struggling to find a non-fugly form for the bracket, I never thought of making it look a bit like a winglet.

Although sorry to burst your bubble, but the engines cannot follow the winglet\'s articulations. Attach points are static.
oh well... gimbals might still do it, it will just shake apart more often... =P
I think we need an SAS module for this stuff. Just so you can have eight of the rockets on max Throttle. 8)
Well if you want, I could turn the strut part of the Firelark into a SAS unit...
seems redundant... all ships i have that are big enough have plenty of space on them to place them

Instead, what about a SAS cap? Put it ontop of the adapter for more aerodynamics and that extra bit of safety the add more Firelarks!

Jeb\'s first practical application of SAS.
Feeling productive tonight. Blaze is out, expect Kabylon pretty soon.

Feeling productive tonight. Blaze is out, expect Kabylon pretty soon.

The link seems to be bad. I get a file not found error. Could it be because the 'p' was left off the end of the filename?

Yep, my bad. Link is fixed now.

Also, should I or should I not make a slightly slanted optional foot for the tower, to help eastbound launches?

my life is complete....

will test it as soon as i get home =P
Project X: horse powered rockets.

well,closest to the VTOL i want that i was able to come is this:

i think i was expanding on a bug or something because i cant,for the love of god, reproduce it... but i was stacking stuff on itself

first i somehow placed it in a weird agle using the symmetry bug,then i kept copying the brackets with engines and stacking them on top until i could somehow place the engine as i wanted.... problem is,now that i have it... i cant recreate it to do the other one =P

hey,im not even sure if you intended that to be possible... but... halp pl0x? =P

edit: and heres how you can do it.... i think... http://i.imgur.com/hKwxH.jpg

Project X: horse powered rockets.

If you could expend on the idea, I might add it on the projects to do list.

Also, Thunder, a little patience. Look on the list: there\'s a project just for you which will be centered on VTOL (I already have a pretty good idea on how it will work. You\'re going to have a HUGE range of motion.)

Also: Project Kebylon is coming along well. Already got the tower done (save for the texture, I\'m saving this for another time), I\'m now trying to get the strut to unveil it\'s secrets to me (to make a new model), I\'m pretty close.

If you could expend on the idea, I might add it on the projects to do list.

Also, Thunder, a little patience. Look on the list: there\'s a project just for you which will be centered on VTOL (I already have a pretty good idea on how it will work. You\'re going to have a HUGE range of motion.)

Also: Project Kebylon is coming along well. Already got the tower done (save for the texture, I\'m saving this for another time), I\'m now trying to get the strut to unveil it\'s secrets to me (to make a new model), I\'m pretty close.

We need a Santa\'s Sleigh in time for Christmas!

i saw that Killer,i just thought id try it anyway.... and when i saw what the HELL i built again i thought you might want to know =P

either way,i suspect much Kerbalness to come from Blaze....

Ah, the satisfaction of doing something that works. The strut has surrendered it\'s secrets to me, and I now possess the ability to create struts of all shapes and kinds. Two more parts and a few textures left, and Kebylon shall be ready.

very nice =P

lately im finding out that the gantry is way too bulky for me, Kebylon might do nicely

Well, Thunder, your image had warranted an investigation.

Turns out that there\'s two things I hadn\'t seen:

Fun fact of the day: Blaze is just as dandy as a landing leg.

Friendly safety reminder of the day: CHECK YOUR ANGLES. While it may seem an enticing idea at first, setting Blaze in angles it\'s not especially meant to go may have... undesirable(?) results.
I love how it seemingly just explodes for no reason.

.....undesirable(?) results.....

HAHAHAHAHA =P

best laugh of the day, and thats when i was teaching coleagues KSP at work today =P

I can\'t get anything to mount on blaze

It even took me ten minutes to get the mounting bracket to attach.
try putting it on something else.... it works fine,ive tested it lots =P
